author: {'steamid': '76561198010007942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 2855, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2855, 'last_played': 1521218729}
review:
I would never have played The Talos Principle if it hadn't been a VR game. I probably should have, as it is a fantastic game. Maybe VR is not necessary in order ot play it, but I wouldn't want to exchange the immersion of being there for anything! Runs beautifully and is probably the best single player game I have ever played. A game that really makes you think on many levels - both in order to solve puzzles and about your life in general.
A must play game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198071471448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1521402105}
review: Croteam did an amazing job porting this game to vr and it shows. It runs smoothly and is a blast to solve all the puzzles the game has in store. This is the way this game is meant to be played, it feels like it was made for vr. 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197983750185', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1523119202}
review:
not that polished
but there are a lot of settings to fine tune locomotion, and the devs are very active and supportive
it looks pretty nice in VR, cant wait to finish the game!
i tried all the different options and for me BLINK teleportation works the best, FYI

author: {'steamid': '76561198394748014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1541817505}
review: Can't play game at all, even with the latest updates.  "An error occurred during license verification. Make sure you're connected to the Internet and try again." Sent a message to support (support@croteam.com) and never received a response.  Requested a refund from Steam, but they said no since I bought the game in the winter sale, but waited more than 2 weeks to start playing it.  Great service all around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008299258', 'num_games_owned': 822, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1709403727}
review: Croteam first impressed me decades ago with Serious Sam, and theyâ€™ve been doing great things in the VR community, so I definitely had to check this one out. Totally different than the mind-numbing action that is Serious Sam, this is a beautifully built, and addicting 3D puzzle game, Iâ€™d say in the same genre as Portal. Itâ€™s extremely well executed in VR, runs smooth, looks great, and is easy to interact with. Iâ€™m 3 hours in, and some of the puzzles are getting pretty tough, and Iâ€™m starting to unlock new items, and pieces of the back story. Iâ€™m looking forward to seeing where this is going, and I definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a triple-A VR puzzle game. Thumbs: UP!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993472726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 8321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2449, 'last_played': 1704658311}
review:
This game is nothing short of amazing. I loved the "flat screen" version of the game so when getting into VR I had no hesitation to buy it again to get the experience of being there myself. Awesome gameplay and story along wiht great controls and immersion.

Rating: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198124393444', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1682183265}
review: Davvero un bel gioco, mi sta tenendo incollato al visore per ore. Alla lunga i rompicapo sembrano un po' tutti uguali, perÃ² procedendo con il gioco cambiano completamente le ambientazioni, anche la sezione egiziana mi ha stupito... Lo consiglio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138955313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1707754184}
review: Truly a msterpiece, we need more games like this, one of the best games i have ever played, the soundtrack is incredible, solving the puzzles is so satisfiying, and its fun unlocking new areas, and getting higher in the tower, i can't wait for the sequel. This game being in VR is amazing, i felt so immursed in the game, definitely the best of the best when it comes to VR games, nothing els like it. Also there is so many options for controls, tops other vr games

author: {'steamid': '76561197982341070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1514349380}
review: Not overly impressed with this game so far. I have only played for 2.3hrs at this point. The graphics are great and you can really get a sense you are in the game but the puzzles are kind of boring and repetitive to me. Maybe there is more to it and I am too quick to judge but I havent rushed to play more as im having a hard time finding the desire to play. Really surprised this game has so many WOW reviews. Probably wouldnt buy it again if given the chance and most likely wont play it again until after I have no other games to play. I can see this game never being finished.

review: I played this on PS4 and it was great, not so much in VR. A total let down. wish i could get my money back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970540567', 'num_games_owned': 871, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1958, 'last_played': 1574218522}
review: This game is great in VR, the puzzles get more challenging as you advance. Lots of choices for graphics and VR options.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960359910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1517260440}
review: Without any doubt one of the best VR games released so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018195459', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1536001458}
review: Top review nailed it. I owned the original and expansion before I bought the VR version. I wish every company would take Croteam's lead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991581948', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1022, 'last_played': 1519518128}
review: Played through 95% of the original flat version, then I got my vive and started playing mostly VR games and Talos started gathering dust in my library. When I saw this was available as a VR version I flip-flopped about buying it, then picked it up during the winter sale. Very happy I did, even opted out of importing my almost complete save from the flat version and am playing through from scratch. Wonderfully executed port to vr. Everything just feels right. Even pressing buttons in the terminal somehow feels like actually pressing buttons. Its been a while since I took off my headset and had to blink for a while to remember I was actually in my office. Well done Croteam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060566692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1516131453}
review: This is a very polished and feature complete VR port. It's very atmospheric too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065517086', 'num_games_owned': 571, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1514797328}
review: Playing a puzzle game like this in VR is VERY cool. Gives you a whole different spacial awareness for your puzzle solving, and it's much lower intensity than most VR games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120018884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1791, 'last_played': 1702313150}
review:
This is actually my first VR game that I've spent more than a week with since I've bough HTC Vive more than a year ago! Absolutely loved it! The concept of puzzle game with philosophical theme is a brilliant idea for a Vive. Talos Principle allows for a a lot of configuration be it a locomotion movement or AA settings and such. You can modify a lot of things including your height, which is very useful and should be done only once, in the beginning.
The story is told by the Voice and a lot of things must be deduced from the surroundings, I loved it very much.
Thank you Cro Team!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994401536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1555633480}
review:
I played the screen version and now I am playing the VR version, and I must say the VR is even better.
Sometimes the solution to puzzles comes more naturally.
The environment is particularly good to be experimented in VR. I had some cool vertigos when pursuing some stars.
The free locomotion system works great. Plenty of options to configure.
It runs flawlessly. Good fps, no crashes at all.
I give it 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197964235833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1515701209}
review: Philosophical, powerful, beautifully-made game, and it fits VR like a glove. Excellent game/conversion Croteam, keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047826312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1517815326}
review:
USEFUL INFO: The supersampling is set in the in-game options. It will not respect what you have selected in advanced settings (assuming you use those (which you should)). For some reason it defaulted to 75% for me, and I thought this game just looked like crap until I fixed it.

Otherwise, I'm enjoying this game so far. Using the teleport locomotion, plus the puzzle solving and island settings remind me heavily of Myst from back in the day. I'll update the review once I finish. One concern is that I'm not getting anything more out of playing this in VR than I would on a monitor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993307833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1677819583}

author: {'steamid': '76561198065372468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1968, 'last_played': 1636515590}
review: This game is a masterpiece.  When I first discovered Talos Principle VR, I purchased it instantly.  Having played and loved the original, I was excited to re-visit the game and experience it from a new perspective.  As It turns out, this is hands down my favorite game of 2017 and one of my most enjoyable VR experiences to date.  Croateam just nailed it.  I have the upmost respect for them.  Some big name devs, I wonâ€™t mention names (Bethesda) are making cash grabs-porting out half assed renditions of their popular IPs, knowing good & well that theyâ€™ll hit target sales through name recognition alone. Not  Croateam.  Talos Principle VR is the result of what happens when devs actually care about creating the best experience and clearly understand what makes VR great. It is the best example of a VR port Iâ€™ve ever played- so much so that it is actually an improvement to its flat predecessor.  I can not recommend this game enough.  If you like 1st person puzzle games like Portal, chances are you will enjoy this as well.  The story has an introspective and enigmatic tone which helps drive progression.  VR mechanics are implemented thoughtfuly- only where they make sense, serving to enhance the game and improve immersion without getting in the way of the core game.  The amount of control you are given over the settings options should be standard practice for ALL VR games. It is so refreshing and nice to be given the freedom to tailor everything from locomotion and color saturation to resolution and other performance tweaks.  Lastly, the amount of content you get- it took me 33 hours for both endings- and I didnâ€™t even get all the bonus stars -not to mention finish â€˜The Road to Gehennaâ€™ is especially generous for a VR game.  Thank you Croateam for actually caring about VR and making this incredible game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132244318', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1514537344}
review:
To be honest i really enjoy this game but in my opinion the port to vr is very lazy and doesn't seem to add anything to the game. I would recommend playing talos principle but the vr of the game is not as polished as i would like. The scenes where you step onto the fan and you are forced to watch your character in 3rd person fly through the air is frankly stupid and ruins immersion. Multiple times while im playing i will see clips of my body in the game. It would be so much easier to just remove the body would it not? Its not like there are any reflection of your body in the water or a mirror?

Once again nothing against the game, it is enjoyable, however unless money is burning a hole in your pocket or you are really desperate for more vr games in your library i wouldn't recommend playing this Version. Save your money and your eyes and play the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996627654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1543073330}

author: {'steamid': '76561198074046884', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1514562649}
review:
[h1]Too Easy, Too Obvious, Too Boring, VR Problems[/h1]
[i]The Talos Principle[/i] is perhaps the most widely revered puzzle game since [i]Portal 2[/i], but for the life of me I can't understand why. The mechanics you can make use of are so basic it's annoying: immobilizer towers just stop anything and are the only thing you can use for the first 10+ puzzles, and the other unlocked mechanics still involve just placing immmovables on the ground and don't have any sort of objects that can move outside your grip (and you can only hold one at a time for some reason even though it only takes one hand to hold anything but the cube/hexahedron). 

Many of the puzzles in the [b]green[/b] and [b]yellow[/b] difficulties require little-to-no brain effort to solve. Simply walk through the puzzle once and the solution is blatantly obvious. The [b]red[/b] difficulty puzzles are the only ones that require any real thought process to figure out. And the secret stars, which are supposed to be even harder accolades than beating [b]red[/b] puzzles, are pretty much all found as part of going through the motions of examining all your options.

As for the story, I can see that they've made an effort, but since I was spending so much time speedrunning to find a redeemably difficuly puzzle in this game before my return window closed, I wasn't able to focus on it enough to get any kind of opinion or even follow the plot. All I know is that I'm a robot in this game and that human civilization seems to have kicked the can long ago.

All of the above problems could also be considered part of the desktop version of [i]The Talos Principle[/i], but I must also complain about the VR implementation some. There is no inventory indicator for anything other than the tiles you've obtained. If you're holding something like keys, there is no inventory indicator that you have them in your posession. And why in the world are there two different movement buttons that do exactly the same thing? The touchpad and the grip buttons are both associated with movement and both are broken in some way. The touchpad-movement has about a 30% chance of working on any given click, and the grip-movement is forever barred from taking you through barriers that have been disabled. How much time in QA would it have taken to identify these issues? It only took me 10 minutes to notice them!

For the difficulty of the puzzles and the basicness of the mechanics in this game, I might recommed the desktop version for ~$10-$15. But the VR version has its own issues that make it annoying and difficult to play and very difficult for me to recommend at all. This really shouldn't have been a separate purchase from the desktop version. Maybe then I wouldn't be asking for a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025441960', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1541524690}
review:
Yeah, it's great. That said:

Forty dollars is, in my opinion, too much to ask for a three year old video game with VR support. Hardware is expensive, damnit. Not all of us can afford to drop full price on these ports. I can't even play Fallout 4 or L.A. Noire, since I have a 970 and can't afford the 400$ for a 1070.

But if you're the type of person who somehow thought sixty dollars for Fallout 4 was okay, you'll probably see this as a steal, considering the actual VR implementation is miles better. You can actually pull switches to activate them, instead of pointing and clicking. This should obviously be standard, but since FO4 VR is charting at #1 for doing less, I suppose this game is luxurious in comparison. 

Lots of great VR options. Lots of great options in general - Croteam is always good about this sort of thing. I got this game for twenty dollars, and at that price Talos VR is completely worth it if you've never played the game before, like me. 

All in all, you don't need me to tell you the game is good. I'm sure you already know that. But Talos is probably the game most suited for VR in Croteam's entire catalog.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960313715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1540682288}
review:
Â¡Â¡Un verdadero videojuego como Dios manda para la RV!! Ya deberÃ­an aprender otras grandes desarrolladoras cÃ³mo se debe hacer un juego, tan sÃ³lo por la calidad tÃ©cnica ya merece tu dinero, enumero las virtudes que le veo habiÃ©ndolo probado un rato:

- LOCOMOCIÃ“N: Te permite configurar absolutamente TODO para que te muevas a tu gusto, en esto de la RV cada uno es un mundo y es algo que se deberÃ­a hacer en todos los juegos. Puedes moverte con el tÃ­pico teletransporte o movimiento clÃ¡sico, pudiendo cerrar el campo de visiÃ³n o no para evitar mareos; lo mismo a la hora de manejar la vista, continuo o a Ã¡ngulos, pudiendo cambiar los grados del giro (15Âº,30Âº,45Âº,etc.)

- GRÃFICOS: Aparte de la buena calidad grÃ¡fica, decir que tiene unas opciones grÃ¡ficas que no tienen nada que envidiar a cualquier juego triple A, te permite incluso cambiar la API entre DirectX 11, 12, OpenGL y Vulkan. TambiÃ©n te permite configurar la resoluciÃ³n tanto en las oculus como en el reflejo del monitor de forma independiente. Esto es algo que deberÃ­a ser lo habitual pero en el mundo de la realidad virtual estamos cansados de ver juegos que tienen para configurar cuatro cosas o ninguna en absoluto, por eso debo resaltarlo.

- LOCALIZACIÃ“N: Â¡Totalmente traducido y DOBLADO al castellano! Y ademÃ¡s un doblaje de buena calidad.

- ADEMÃS a los que tenemos Oculus nos permite ejecutar el juego directamente en la app de Oculus sin tener que tener abierto el SteamVR, lo cual se agradece muchÃ­simo y es algo que no he visto en ningÃºn otro videojuego.

Yo suelo esperar a que baje mucho el precio de los juegos, pero con Ã©ste he hecho una excepciÃ³n y lo he comprado rebajado a 18,50 euros. Creo que los usuarios de Oculus y Vive debemos apoyar los pocos productos de calidad que nos llegan para que se generalice esta forma de hacer bien las cosas, mÃ¡xime cuando viene doblado al castellano y en RV no vienen traducidos ni la mitad, y de los doblajes ni hablemos. Por ello creo que hay que premiar a los creadores de este juego rascÃ¡ndonos el bolsillo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034124189', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1611525373}
review:
UPDATE AS OF 10/14/19:
Haven't logged into Steam in a few months and found a few comments letting me know most things have been fixed and to edit my review so it's not outdated or potentially misleading. Changed it to 'recommended' but keep in mind, I have not played the game since 2017 when there were tons of issues. I have no idea if they're fixed and I likely won't buy the game at full price to find out/verify the comments' claims. I just don't want a 2-year old review that's hardly relevant anymore bringing the game's sales down when it's likely been greatly improved since.

If I do purchase the game and verify, I'll make sure to update my review to something that's actually helpful/relevant. 

=======================================================================
REVIEW AS OF 2017:
Can't recommend this for Oculus, unfortunately. I've played and beaten the original version to full completion as well as Sigils of Elohim and all available DLC for the base game. As such, I come from a place of understanding with this game and have something to refer to as a "proper" experience.

I own an Oculus Rift with Touch and a 3-sensor setup. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this game for Oculus, at the very least. Movement is finicky at best, which left me jerking around through walls and barriers to the point where I saw my character model teleport a few feet ahead of me. Anytime I would lay down a jammer to turn off a blue barrier, I would try to move through it and would get caught in the middle of it, unable to move. I've found the only way to get through these barriers is to spam the teleport button in order to move through it. This happened so often, I can't defend it by saying it might have been a hiccup. 

On top of this, the Oculus Touch controllers were absolutely not considered when porting this out for VR; this game was absolutely developed with Vive in mind, and does not accomodate Touch well. I say this due to the strange button mappings. Using the grip buttons does not allow the player to pick up objects, the trigger do that. Instead, the grips teleport the player, and the joysticks only turn the player. Many games developed for Oculus map the joysticks to teleport when pressed forward  and allow the direction to be changed when spinning them.

This last one is just a minor complaint, but it definitely shows how little was considered when porting this out: the character models makes stepping sound effects when the player moves their head. I understand that this is likely just a "The player's facing direction moved, therefore his body turns, therefore he steps, therefore use the step sound effect", but this definitely shows a lack of polish for a $40MSRP game. 

Overall, this does not feel even close to premium, and you will likely be fighting the game's programming throughout your playthrough. There is a ton of content and the game itself is one of the best puzzle games I've ever played, but I cannot recommend this port in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114950900', 'num_games_owned': 533, 'num_reviews': 254, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1587087588}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993265431', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1534133454}

author: {'steamid': '76561198078395542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1700481271}
review:
Not finished it yet but what a ride!

Mind blowing visuals! Great story! Good puzzles!


Of course it is not perfect and there are some problems with VR version. Got lot of stuttering on default settings so had to roll back on low but that doesnt make game look bad at all. author: {'steamid': '76561198013377777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1541871036}
review:
I'm really enjoying this first-person puzzle game. I haven't played the original game but had heard good things about it, so when I saw the VR version was released I used that as an excuse to get it. I haven't been disappointed!

As I write this, I'm not even close to having finished the game, but I'm really enjoying the atmosphere and the mysterious back story which seems to be building nicely. The puzzles themselves are excellent and I'm getting slightly addicted.

The game works really well in VR. If I wasn't aware of the original game, I would have assumed it was made for VR. The game is broken up nicely, being divided into a bunch of individual puzzles which you can tackle as you please; in a VR game I find it useful when there are frequent, well-defined potential stopping points, otherwise my legs get stiff and my eyes get tired!

There are a range of different movement options. I get motion sickness, so teleport with blink is always my preference. Doesn't take anything away from the game.

All in all, if you enjoy first-person puzzle games, have a compatible VR headset and haven't already played The Talos Principle, I would highly recommend you get this VR version of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005772688', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1563311039}
review: One of my favorite puzzle games of the past few years gets a fantastic VR release, bringing where I believe the game belongs. Solve fun puzzles from that perspective and immersion only VR can deliver. Excellent music, writing and it's unique ancient/technical settings really set this game apart. This is the best version of this game, and a must buy for any puzzle fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263764893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2253, 'last_played': 1566775859}
review:
Great Game.

Although it has some minor flaws, it is a joy forever. Story fits the vr theme perfectly. Puzzles start out slow, but include some really neat ideas down the line ( make sure to try to collect all the hidden stars, some are really tricky ) 

Never played the Flat Version, but I would recommend this title to anyone having a Headset.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991873024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1513574094}
review:
I have already played The Talos Principle using a traditional PC setup, but jumped at the chance to play it again (and try the Road to Gehnna DLC) in VR (using Windows Mixed Reality).  The game is perfect for VR!  The puzzles are just as fun to solve while immersed in the world as they are looking at a screen.  Since it's been so long since I've played it, the puzzles feel fresh again, and figuring things out from my own perspective makes solving them feel even more satisfying due to the physical nature of moving the set pieces around.  

Movement is handled very well in Talos Principle VR!  I personally prefer the teleport system, but that's augmented with the ability to click the touchpads and rotate and/or take small steps forwards, backwards, and strafing.  The results in movement that doesn't result in me getting sick but still lets me fine-tune my position without twisting every which way to get the perspective "just right" to solve a puzzle. 

The only time I ever felt sick was when a new area first loads.  Frame rate even on a high-end PC can tank in a new area.  Closing my eyes for about a minute lets things stabilize, and after the initial load I have no problems. 

I highly recommend this game as one of the first VR games you should buy (if you like puzzle games).  The story, music, and mind-bending puzzles will keep you entertained for many, many hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979982910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1545549803}
review:
To lead off I'd just like to say TTP is a great game, and if you haven't played it in its non-VR variant then getting this is a no brainer. If you have...hmmm...read on. I plan to keep this one short-n-sweet.

So, I grabbed this during the recent sale having loved the original, but not having played the DLC. It helped to sell me that I was at least getting some value added just past the VR conversion. I started playing the game and quickly came to the realization that while it was a very excellently done port, I didn't find VR added much to the experience. If you really liked the world and environment and want to explore it more intimately, then absolutely go for it. But as far as it being a game for VR, in my opinion it just felt like a game better played outside VR.

It felt fine enough to play in VR, so there is no problem with it feeling clunky or poorly done. It did feel a little less...smooth to play in VR? It's hard to put my finger on it. It did remind me how much I liked the original until I got stuck near the end on a time-warp puzzle, and I think I'll go back and play that. Heck, I will probably buy the DLC as well. But I think I'll end up refunding this and buying some other games I don't already have.

There is plenty to like here and I think, for the right person, even double-dipping isn't out of the question. But if you already played the game outside VR, then give it a little bit more thought before you take the plunge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970549621', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1513459460}
review:
I'm only reviewing the VR conversion since the regular game has plenty of reviews if you want to know about that.

They did a really great job of giving options to the player.  Controls include teleport, step movement, free movement (classic) or various combinations of all of them.  The only thing missing as far as I can tell is free movement on one hand with teleport on the other which would be my personal preference.

The game ran very well in Direct3d11 (Direct3d12 performance was awful but that's in beta) and I was able to run at 150% resolution without reprojection although my system is powerful (1080ti) so YMMV.

I also find that the pace of the game really lends itself to VR since solving puzzles in 3D space feels natural in VR.  It also has the plus of being a different game from a lot of the others out there (no shooting!) and since it's a full game it has a lot of hours of real quality Vr gameplay.

The VR conversion is excellent so if you like puzzle games with nice atmosphere you should give it a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999264751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1513397152}

author: {'steamid': '76561198139428356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4249, 'last_played': 1543810177}
review:
I finished Talos Principle on the Rift about a week ago. Wow! What a ride! I'm a huge fan of puzzle-based adventures. I loved Obduction (new game by the makers of Myst) in VR also. While I prefer the style of Obduction, where the puzzles are integrated into the world and help tell the story, I have to say that Talos Principle is incredibly well put together. The puzzles (and there's gotta be over 100 of them) become gradually more difficult as you work you way through and learn the mechanics of the game.

I'm currently finishing the "star puzzles", as I've heard there is a second ending if you do so...trying to avoid seeing spoilers.

I also have to add that climbing the tower is phenomenal in VR.

And the VR version comes with the sequel (Road to Gehenna) included.

If you are remotely a fan of puzzle adventures, you must play Talos Principle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198360877777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 751, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 751, 'last_played': 1513037364}
review: WOW, a Croteam port to VR beats most new VR games!  I've played all Croteam VR titles and this one meets or exceeds the best.  This is not a blood and guts shooter but is a very fun to play atmospheric puzzle exploration game.  The puzzles aren't too difficult but not too easy either, and the subplot is interesting and unique.  This is a must own VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963225974', 'num_games_owned': 2361, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 1748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1739, 'last_played': 1636254457}
review:
I completed the base game last week, and I have to say... it was well worth the effort, all 28 hours of it. That said I have yet to attempt getting all the stars or even looking at the included DLC, which I've heard is very good, so there is more to do!

My perspective is from someone who bought the original to try the DK2 beta branch in 2015, then decided to wait for a proper release version for VR, which took two years! This means I had experienced practically nothing of the game on a screen before jumping into VR, and to me personally I am happy I waited as I only play puzzle games once as the challenge is removed for me after that.

[b]What hooked me[/b]:
[list]
[*]The ever increasing variation of puzzles, mechanics, items and environments.
[*]The subtle but intense story delivered through various means, I so love mystery. Very suitable for a VR game too.
[*]Solving puzzles in VR is a favorite, because the deep reasoning it has me do makes me forget about reality and quite transports me. It's slightly reduced in this game due to the levels being larger than room-scale, but it was still quite meditative at times.
[*]Plenty of options for locomotion, no pigeonholing.
[/list]
[b]Pro-tips[/b]:
[list]
[*]If you use joystick locomotion, you can change your speed under Game Options, it's not under VR Options.
[*]When you see the highlight of two feet on a surface, it means you can automatically jump there with a button press, this means you don't have to do platforming if you don't want to. Pretty convenient.
[*]They made terminal scrolling go whole pages instead of single lines, at first I thought it was just hyper speed scrolling which made me careful to use it, but it's really a single page-down action so it's fine.
[*]If you hold both grip buttons you fast forward time, which can be useful. I figured this out after I had finished the game already...
[/list]
[b]Gotchas[/b]:
[list]
[*] As in the original you moved things around with a mouse cursor/cross hair you are limited to carrying one thing at a time in the VR version, anything else would break many puzzles. This of course felt strange early on as you do get two hands in the game. After a while I just used my secondary hand for navigation though, and moved things around mainly with my primary.
[*] Story and interactions are mainly told by interacting with text interfaces. At first I thought I would get tried of reading text in VR quickly, but then they fed me tidbits of the story and I compulsively read any terminal message I could find. Pretty deep stuff.
[*] I pulled down quality after a while to get better performance, the visual fidelity was not that different so it felt like a good compromise. Many areas work just fine but there are places where it does slow down, I'm on a 1070 and an i5 though, so mid-tier I guess?
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561197974393974', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1202, 'last_played': 1509763927}

author: {'steamid': '76561198080558943', 'num_games_owned': 299, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1512879372}
review: The game is fucking fantastic, don't get me wrong. But oh my god this version makes me so sick. Teleporting... really? It maeks me fall to the ground its so disorienting, I have only played about 13 minutes and I feel sick.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963516671', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 267, 'last_played': 1648852271}
review:
This was one of the first games I purchased when I got VR. I loved this game on console so figured it was a safe bet and I couldn't have been more right.

Talos Principle translates so well to VR you would have thought that this was developed natively for VR. Out of the box the teleport control is enabled which is actually pretty good, but I prefer to use locomotion. Luckily Croteam is awesome and allows you to finely tune all of your VR controls. There are quite a few options to really customize your experience.

The graphics are also really good and just like VR controls, these can be finely tuned. 

You really can't go wrong with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013957136', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1512799521}
review: I unfortunately cannot recommend this game. The game itself is just fine, but it gives me a headache for whatever reason. I also get motionsick playing this game in the VR version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027932402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1512823652}
review: Worth every cent!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015368019', 'num_games_owned': 2128, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1533087208}
review:
The game itself is the same as the non VR version so I'll focus on the VR implementation.
First off the game itself is a very good fit for VR due to its theme, even if it wasn't originally designed as a VR experience.
Croteam did a very good job porting their game, there are lots of locomotion options including stick movement, teleportation and confort settings.
On the other hand you can notice that the object manipulation is a bit clunky because is constrained by the limitations of the original version design, that makes some very few puzzles a bit difficult to figure if you didn't play the original version, but it nothing serious.
This is one of the best VR games I played so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027851889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1659649298}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970912927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1429, 'last_played': 1512445899}
review:

however the biggest selling point for me is how long it takes to copmplete. So much content compared to other games. 

I played the original but not the expansion. I enjoyed the expansion so much I'd say it is worth the asking price by itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040839761', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1553024915}

author: {'steamid': '76561198399349544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1512809345}
review: Inconsistent response to controller inputs makes a lot of these puzzles unplayable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049889390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1549, 'last_played': 1586591963}
review:
This is awesome! At first I was a bit sceptic for "puzzle" scenario but after hour or so this really hooks you in. After that its all finishing frenzy. Fortunately heres also that philosophical side. Just need to restrain and remember to enjoy the scenery.

Something to improve would be even more choices for movement. Teleport doesn't make it in some (atleast one) case and you need classic movement. Though I took 99,9% with teleport movement. Would love some mixed option where jump/air movement would be on full view and normal transition just on teleport. 

But overall deep analysis: I want to go thru it again

author: {'steamid': '76561198006203821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1514329632}
review: I played through the first one and loved it on PS4 (got a platinum trophy) so playing this in VR is a no brainer its way more fun. No problems with loading or any gameplay for me. The only complaint I have is the teleport can sorta of cheese some of the puzzle, or at least how I was playing them.... all in all I was going to buy the regular version to play again on PC but once I saw the VR one there was no question & it includes the DLC!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970728801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1512865813}
review: Absolutely fantastic! This is the Portal-like game I've been waiting for in VR. Though saying Portal-like is doing it injustice, as while there's some common elements (AI letting you solve puzzles, a story that slowly develops as the game progresses), the games have their own character. The environments are amazing and surprising as well - and the puzzles sometimes allow for 'game breaking' cleverness to get an extra bonus. As for VR, it's a really comfortable experience for me: movement is handled well and the environments really suit stopping for a second and just look around. The puzzle mechanics are very nice as well with new elements being introduced slowly. In terms of difficulty, it's a bit all over the place: some puzzles are very easy, some more difficult (though, so far, not super hard). But on the other hand that also means that you never quite know what you're going to get. In all: love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045758768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1511908828}
review: Holy hell. This game is one of the best VR experiences I have played to date. literally perfect. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198009928642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1512947775}
review:
I struggled getting into this game on the traditional version. Wandering around, pointing and clicking stuff with my mouse was okay, but not captivating enough to hold my attention.

In VR, this game really shines. Instead of just skimming through the computer screens and progressing on to the puzzle, I find myself super excited to get to the next console so I can progress the story. On the computer screen, it rains, and it barely registers as a conscious thought. In VR, it rains and I find myself staring at the vast expanse of sky, and looking at how the rain drops hit the puddles and the trees.

Overall, it's a very well made port.The controls are intuitive, and I feel like VR makes this game more enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041447747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1698608470}
review:
New puzzles! Yay! 

If anyone told me a few years ago that being "inside" the Talos
world like this, in such an enchanting way, would even be possible,
I doubt I'd have believed them, but it's true. Wonderful sense the
environment. All the items are easy to interact with, love the scale
of the tripod projectors and other elements, although perhaps the
terminals themselves should be a bit larger, as you have to get quite
close to them to start using them comfortably.

The sphere enemies are very ominous indeed! 

Quite a scare, though, the first time you get exploded...
the game being so peaceful up to that point. 
I wonder if a perhaps a "slightly defective sphere" should not 
be used for the first time, to avoid scaring the wits out of new players?
Then explain that normally, they explode?

One quirk I noticed was that the menu button no longer worked 
for me in the hall with all the numbered portals, I only got a black display.

author: {'steamid': '76561198317275164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1511726251}
review: Teleportation does not work well for the game as the game was not initially designed for it. Then the walking can only be done in a straight line or with slight adjustments with head tracking on. Any slight left or right on the joystick changes direction making the game play un-immersive. The game needs to have an option to allow the player to move any direction with the joystick not just sharp turns. Other than that decent game as I played the non-VR before. I just wish the rotation was smoother.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970945132', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1604021307}
review: I own the non-VR version of this game and played through about many, many hours before picking the VR version up.  I honestly wasn't initially enthusiastic about buying the VR version since I already owned it, but boy was I wrong.  The VR version is extremely compelling and is well worth buying even if you own the "flat" version of the game.  The gameplay in Talos speaks for itself--the puzzles are great and challenging.  The voice acting and plot (as it is) are extremely well done.  The graphics in the non-VR version are stunning.  VR brings all of that to life in a way that is difficult to describe.  Each of those great qualities is enhanced and makes for an awesome experience.  Also, as with all Croteam VR titles, they go out of their way to provide all sorts of VR options for both graphics quality, locomotion, controls, and new VR equipment (as I write this, they've already patched to support the less than 1 month old Windows MR hardware).

author: {'steamid': '76561197998815192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1699472399}

author: {'steamid': '76561197975585301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1511681327}
review: Purchased this game in the Croteam Bundle. I do own the 2d version of Talos and have played a couple hours of the campaign but now I am thankful for my backlog of games that I waited to play through this in VR. This game is just as incredible as you can imagine Talos being in VR. The motion control mechanics work well and in some instances being able to peak around the corner or interect with the environment even improves the game. Don't hestitate on getting Talos Principle VR, it's well worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013500008', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1525804226}
review: The Talos Principle is one of my favourite games of all time. I liked the idea of having it in VR from fairly early on. Once I got a VR headset, Talos was the number one game I really wanted VR for. And we finally got it. And I love it. I will concede that it's not necessarily worth the buy if you already have the game and aren't too fussed about VR, but if you have VR, like puzzle games, have any interest whatsoever in philosophy, and don't already have the game, it's certainly worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030453236', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1522022519}
review:
I was about halfway through Talos when it came out for VR so I decided I'd buy it and try it from the beginning. I'm do glad I did. This is one of those games that is just made for VR and is so much better than playing on a screen.

CroTeam has done an amazing job in porting this over to VR. Everything from the detailed options menu to the multiple movement options; you can tell that they put a lot of effort into making the game work for VR.

The story is very fitting for the medium and the world is definitely more immersive as you get a sense of scale and depth to everything.  The length of this game and it's detail (a benefit of being a PC game port) make this easily one of the longest and best games out for VR.

If you enjoy thinking puzzle games and have not played this game, the VR version is the best way to play it and is a no brainier to get.  Having already played part of the game, I'm so glad I get to finish it in VR! CroTeam has done amazing work for the VR community and you should reward them and yourself by picking up this gem

author: {'steamid': '76561198009385242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1511321194}
review:
If you like Talos Principle, you should already own this.

If you tried Talos Principle, but never really got into it, you should try this; a totally different experience.

If you've never tried Talos Principle, and feel like wracking your brain to solve a puzzle, you definitely need to try this. !Thinking outside the box will be necessary (or thinking inside if you are already out there).

As usual, Croteam included all of the graphics and control settings you would need, as well as an all-around fun and entertaining game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052895835', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1816, 'last_played': 1653136618}
review:
Absolutely loved this game.  And that comes after having beat the original version of the game.  There were still a few puzzles in the expansion I had not solved and while they were the best part, the whole of the game was pretty new again playing it in VR.

Croteam really went beyond in adapting the game for VR.  Object interactions  are very intuitive for the most part and not just button click in original game translates to button press in VR.  Many different motion options to accommodate even people like myself who have strong VR sickness.

For one puzzle, I did have to switch controls to smooth motion to solve.  Otherwise, the rest of the game seems solvable with teleport while teleport gives you no real advantage over smooth that I noticed.  (Of course being prone to VR sickness I did not test that extensively.)  All in all it feels the devs put a lot of effort into balancing and making sure everything works in whatever mode you play.

Heard rumors of Talos 2 in development and cannot wait for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000790392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 458, 'last_played': 1692563231}
review: This is everything I've been waiting for in VR: Beautifully immersive environments specifically re-tailored for virtual reality, huge amount of dense, story-rich content I can spend hours and hours in game on, brain-melting puzzling, and science-fictional ruminations on artificial intelligence, consciousness, life extension, and philosophy. I love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104663883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1510524916}
review:
I never played The Talos Principle on the flat screen but I love puzzle games, love VR and was desperate for VR content that lasted longer than a few hours. This game gets me hooked for at least an hour or two each time I turn it on. So far none of the puzzles have been all that difficult but I am just now unlocking more tools and the puzzles are starting to increase in complexity. 
Items I enjoyed: 
- The atmosphere is great. The game is very scenic and they allow you to venture out a little in the world even though there isn't much to do aside from a few hidden pieces of the story or notes here and there. 
- Sound: The sound of the ocean,waves and birds adds to the atomsphere. When god speaks down to you it the surround sound is tremendous and makes it feal like the devine maker is really addressing you.
- Story: So far so good it is really deap and and probably not for everyone.
- Puzzles: while I haven't hit any challenging ones yet, I like all the different dynamics that come into play. I can see how the difficulty might progress with all the different "enemy types", road blocks as well as all the different tools. I do like that it appears to open up some and there are going to be many puzzles where there are multiple ways to solve.
- Options: I like a all the options and settings that are available. I prefer trackpad movement but ended up teleporting in this game. Since there is so much ground to cover I prefer to teleport to get across faster. The ability to rotate your postion with the trackpad is nice too. I only seem to get motion sickness when I use trackpad and have to physically turn alot. This game will not cause sickness issues with me.
Things I didn't like: I can't say there is anything I really dislike but a few things I didn't care for. 
- Reading a lot of text: I know this is how the story was originally told in the pancake version but for VR reading a lot of notes on a monitor to get the story is not welcome. I am not sure what the solution is maybe offering a text to speach option. 
- Need more reasons to roam: As I mentioned the atmosphere is great and some of the areas are really relaxing. They give the the ability to explore the beaches a little and the cliffs but there is nothing to do there. Maybe add a few more story element notes, collectibles or add a few VR mechanics like skipping or throwing rocks, fishing, flying a kite I don't know something to do out there the land is vast and void. 

Overall loving the game I have a lot more to go, support these devs they have given a lot of content to the community when a lot of other studios are waiting. I know a lot of people have already bought this game years ago but it is so clever I am sure if you liked it then you will enjoy it again. If you are just searching for VR content this game doesn't add any mind blowing VR mechanics but it is extremely deep and fun will keep you busy for weeks (until December when a few more great games get released). 
Toots

author: {'steamid': '76561198046156381', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1342, 'last_played': 1561760605}
review:
A masterpiece in VR. I played this on vive with classic locomotion (head tracked) untethered and truly felt engrossed in another world for hours (unlike many of the shorter experiences many VR games are offering) The puzzles are great fun and the graphics are top notch with generous SS applied. An awesome atmosphere and stunning worlds had me standing still just taking it all in on occassions

Only gripe has been placing/grabbing items is sometimes a bit glitchy (especially if above or below you) - a number of times I found myself trying to carry out certain actions, considering them impossible and not the solution, finally give up and shamefully watch a level guide to see the exact thing i had attempted was the correct way

Other than that i canâ€™t fault the experience. One of my favourite Vive games so far since launch

author: {'steamid': '76561197970755891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2461, 'last_played': 1529273199}
review:
Bought non-VR version on sale, played through, including all stars. Loved it. Was kind of sad it was over.

Bought an Oculus since then. HAPPILY paid full retail price for VR version. No longer sad. Except I've almost finished it again.

Message to all game developers: I will re-buy every single first-person title I own at full retail price if you do as good a job of bring it to VR as Croteam has with Talos and Serious Sams. Totally worth it, and so far, they have outclassed every VR-only title I own, and I own dozens.

Study them and learn, developers. Particularly the copious customization options, and particularly regarding movement. I'm a full-speed motion junkie, but I have friends who have to use teleport to prevent motion sickness. All VR games simply must have both.

Well done. More games, please.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041988789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 2327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2100, 'last_played': 1511070991}
review:
Love it. Love it. Love it.

When I saw the Talos Principle for standard experience (2D, not VR) I was incredibly intrigued. Sadly, I couldn't play it as I get quite a bit of motion sickness from FPS perspective games. So, when I saw that it came out for VR, I jumped on it.

The puzzles are great, the experience is great, pretty much everything is great.

I've finished all the content that the base game has to offer and I'm now working on the DLC Road to Gehenna.Should you get this game? Yeah, I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009368508', 'num_games_owned': 427, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1510600547}
review:
This is an excellent port of the 2D version. It feels like it was made from the ground up, almost.
Next to no scaling issues, and good customization in the controls. Still would like some more options of locomotion, but at least you can walk with trackpad if you want. I understand it's difficult to implement locomotion in a puzzle game like this.

Anyway, the game itself is fantastic. I loved The Talos Principle on a screen, and I love it now.
It's super atmospheric, and really makes you think about some heavy stuff.
So this review is mostly about the VR port, which is great.

I think this is the way Talos Principle should be played. It's so immersive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 279, 'last_played': 1584918401}
review: Encore un coup de maÃ®tre de Croteam avec ce superbe titre que je redÃ©couvre avec plaisir en VR. Ce jeu prenant et intelligent est vraiment magnifique en immersion. Seul problÃ¨me: avec tous les paramÃ©trages, on voit Ã  quel point il pourrait Ãªtre encore plus beau et on a juste envie de troquer sa config pour quelque chose de beaucoup plus musclÃ©!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969984517', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 34, 'playtime_at_review': 3249, 'last_played': 1711252567}
review:
One of the best VR games I have played so far. I played through the flat version and enjoyed it a few years ago but VR is where this game shines. After 50 hours in it, I am still blown away. The devs really know their VR and I hope they get the sales to continue to amaze me. 

I have eagerly awaited the VR conversion since playing the partial support on the DK2 and the recent demo map.

It looks gorgeous on a 1080 ti but it is pushing mine pretty hard at 2.0 SS and I can just get it to run smooth on a 1070 at 1.25 SS. I still get an intermittent stutter once in awhile though. I am not sure how clear you could get it on a lower card but I assume you could knock down some other settings to keep the SS up. It really needs it or it could be blurry below 1.25.

If you enjoy exploring, solving rewarding puzzles, science fiction, AI, and mystery, I am sure you will enjoy this game. 

The early puzzles are super easy, but don't let that fool you, once you get into the story and into the harder puzzles, you will probably get sucked in like I did.

A VR masterpiece! Thanks Croteam!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030788633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1511133047}
review: Highly recommended. The story is fantastic and the execution is done extremely well. Talos works as perfectly it would as if it was made for VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978829443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1568147441}
review: A wonderful experience. Talos was meant to be in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017125492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1513150581}
review:
Wow. This game is amazing in VR. I don't own the pancake version but this has blown me away. The puzzles are fun, the story has me interested, and best of all this game supports VR SLI. With 2 GTX980Ti this game looks amazing. I feel like I'm playing Witcher 3 VR with graphics this impressive. 

The game is full of options, including teleport or onward style movement. There is something for everyone here. Another great game by Croteam. This game seriously reminds me of Portal. I had a blast in that game and this looks to be another take on the genre.

If you have VR, get this game. Especially if you want an actual game, instead of a demo.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995839344', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1510864298}
review:
I love this game.

Despite being a conversion from the flat game, it's one of the best VR games I've played. It's absolutely wonderful to be in this weird and wondrous world, interacting with computer terminals and solving puzzles, all with a fantastic soundscape (ambient sound effects are great and the music is beautiful).

Add to that an interesting, thought-provoking backstory, and you have a marvel of a game.

Now excuse me while I return to the world of Talos. Elohim awaits!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972416553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 552, 'last_played': 1565806915}
review:
Only 4 hours on play, so far this is easily my favourite VR game (I love thoughtful, clever puzzle games, I love philosophy and I love Sci-Fi, and so far this seems like a perfect marriage of all three. 

I am only writing this review very early, as sales of this game on VR are really weak, but this is a fully fledged game that runs fantastic and works great in VR. If you're on the fence, buy it... and let me know what you think in the comments :-)

10/10 so Far. I will change this on completion of the Game

author: {'steamid': '76561197963799625', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2145, 'last_played': 1571914031}
review:
Edit: After having finished the game with all possible endings I can only second everything below. Plus a few tips:

* Do yourself a favor and try to avoid googling for answers or using guides. You'll get there eventually and the experience is so much more satisfying.

* If you're afraid of heights like I am - be careful where you step on that dreadful tower! XD

This has been my most interesting VR experience so far - and I'm not even finished yet. I was wanting to play the game for a long time but didn't get to it so I jumped right into the VR mode (which is on point by the way - there are tons of customization options to make you feel comfortable in VR - exactly like the Serious Sam VR versions - nice work Croteam!)

I tend to take my time in games, read all the lore and look around for a while, so the slow pace seems perfect for me. The overall aesthetics are also very nice in my opinion. I even caught myself cranking up the visuals in between just to get the most out of it when I'm not moving around too much or solving puzzles (which can be quite challenging - it's a good thing!).

As for performance: Runs relatively smooth (just a few hiccups here and there) on a 1070 with 200% rendering size and GPU on high with an i7-6800K.

If you like portal, only a little bit slower; if you daydream about the human mind and consciousness; if you like greek mythology and ancient architecture - go for it! 

Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987456721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1705727255}
review: Finally a full VR campaign that is longer than just a few hours. Definitely in my top 3 favorite VR games. $40 is a lot to spend on a VR game, but this was worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972320403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1512255529}
review:
So far (after playing the first hour) I really like it. The puzzles fit VR, the graphics look nice and the story is told in a way that keeps me interested. You can choose from many different locomotion methods and I chose a "dash forward" style movement as in Raw Data or the upcoming Doom.
Now I'm looking forward to sinking deeper into the story and solve puzzle after puzzle... And in between I will take a minute, sit down on the beach relax.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103484859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1509794073}
review:

Hab es jetzt zu ca. 50% durchgespielt mit 7,5 Std Spielzeit. Geh mal davon aus das ich fÃ¼r den Rest etwas lÃ¤nger brauche also geschÃ¤tzte 30 Std Spielzeit. 
Die RÃ¤tsel treffen genau den richtigen Schwierigkeitsgrad, wodurch man nie den Spielspass verliert.
Zum GlÃ¼ck hatte ich das Spiel vorher noch nicht gespielt und erst jetzt mit VR das erste mal entdeckt.
