author: {'steamid': '76561198052376009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1512329079}
review: Never played the pancake version of this game but I am so happy that I got to experience this in VR.  An extraordinarily well made game that is perfectly implemented in VR.  Thank you Croteam for being one of the true pioneers of VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971119411', 'num_games_owned': 695, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1550172368}
review: I already beat the original version, but it's so good in VR that I'm playing it all over again. The puzzles work very well in VR, like aiming the disruptors. Also, Croteam has provided many options for customizing the locomotion, which is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027647796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1510173126}
review:
Original Review URL - http://www.htcvivegamereviews.com/all-review-list/logical-decision-talos-principle-vr/
Let's Play URL - http://www.htcvivegamereviews.com/all-video-list/here-comes-the-boom-talos-principle-vr-htc-vive-world-a1-pt-1/

Grade A

Although The Talos Principle was a 2014 title â€“ I have never played the non-VR title. The Talos Principle is a puzzle game in which you are a robot given the task of solving various puzzles from a â€œhubâ€ to smaller â€œtrialsâ€ with clever names. The names of the puzzles usually are a hint to the task ahead of what you face.

Unlike some other puzzle games Iâ€™ve played â€“ Talos Principle is very fair. It shows you the pieces of the puzzle such as tools to connect beams or beams that suppress force field doors. There is no easter egg hunt to find random components or parts. Your goal is to use these tools to reach an end sigil of each trial. As you play the game, you unlock more tools and more worlds to explore.

There is a deep story written within the Talos Principle utilizing voice-over memories and computers you can interact with. To be fair, I havenâ€™t engrossed myself into this aspect of the game but I can tell there was effort put into creating more than just the puzzle game itself.

I am not usually a puzzle genre player but The Talos Principle VR feels great to play. The visuals are polished and movement is natural with teleport(and they have other locomotion options enabled!). When you figure out a puzzle and have that eureka moment â€“ itâ€™s a great feeling to hear that â€œclaimed sigilâ€ sound.

The game currently retails at $39.99 on steamVR which might be high but it is a true polished, finished game that won countless awards for itâ€™s NON-VR version and I can see why.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049197031', 'num_games_owned': 897, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 581, 'last_played': 1667125646}
review: One word: AWESOME!

author: {'steamid': '76561197976009007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1512043347}
review:
OK, if you like one of the following: Science Fiction, AI, philosophy and puzzles I strongly adivce you to get "The Talos Principle"!
I'm not a huge puzzle fan myself, but I really came to LOVE it in a very short time!
It's really well optimized for VR and looks really really good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992821666', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1660983202}
review:
This game is absolutely perfect for VR, and the gameplay shows the depth and concideration that many other titles with VR support haven't been able to show. Gorgeous world, a pleasure to explore and it really pops after tweaking the colour, contrast and gamma settings, which I really appreciate as you can make it as stark or vibrant as you want.

Puzzles are tough, sometimes made all the more difficult by being unable to decode tidbits and chunks of data without taking off a headset, but after spending an hour removing chunks of hair while screaming at a puzzle, only to come back and complete it first try later cause you missed something obvious, it really hammers in both a sense of acomplishment and success.

Highly recommended for VR. Equally recommended for flatscreen people too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063942102', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 486, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1557065926}
review:
Really liking this game so far.  Polished and great graphics.

  Definitely recommend even though I haven't finished  it yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962810553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1564715516}
review: Great game with stunning beauty to look at.  The game is thoughtful, entertaining, and mezmerizing.  So glad Croteam decided to remake this game for VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998218966', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1516262600}
review:
It's a puzzle game. There is a decent mix of puzzle elements, some less fun to work with than others, but I think overall the game hits the sweet spot with its level of difficulty. Some puzzles will be a breeze, others will cause you think harder and possibly have to revisit them, but will ultimately make you feel like a genius upon finding the solution (or an idiot if the solution was actually braindead simple). The kicker is that it also has a really great narrative (think Westworld-lite) and some gorgeous environments that are all the more breathtaking in VR. 

probably the best VR game I've played so far and I've had my rift for a year and a half now. Also it's MUCH longer than just about every made-for-VR game. First playthrough took me 18 hours and I haven't even touched the expansion yet.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198209264320', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1512577566}
review:
The game is much better in VR. No motion sickness thanks to BLINK teleport. Highly polished perfect puzzles with relaxing environment.

9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031292484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1512984046}
review:
The Talos Principle really is brought to life in VR! This is very immersive experience, you cant help but start to wonder what these puzzles are all about. Who are you and what is this place? 

The game has a lot of content compared to most VR titles, so you do get value for your money. At least if you havent playd Talos Principle, now it is the time to do just that!

Pros
Immersive story line
Nice puzzles that progressively teach new ways to interact with various objects and the environment
A lot of content (tons of it compared to most VR titles), I have not yet entered all the worlds is the main game when writing this review and there is the Road to Gehenna DLC includes in the price..

Cons
Oculus Rift Touch controls are a bit awkwardly implemented, but should not complain, I can play it just fine

author: {'steamid': '76561198036250410', 'num_games_owned': 1719, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1821, 'last_played': 1509201534}
review: The final puzzle on the top of the tower is such weapons grade 'fuck you' bullshit that it has completely destroyed all of the positive feeling I had about this game, and it's safe to say I will never buy anything made by the same devs again. Thanks for nothing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125638954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1514235256}
review:
Mother of god... this is amazing. First off, loved the base game (one of like 2 games I took the time to 100%), but even without that affection I'd still love this.

This is the first VR game I've played that actually feels like a game: when I try to push my head through a wall, it pushes me back so I can't; the movement doesn't rely on teleportation to actually make the game be playable; all the data from the HUD is available and non-intrusive... my god, it's actually immersive.

The gameplay itself is just the same as the base non-VR version: they didn't cut out various bits of the game to make it more VR-compatible. It still looks, and feels, like The Talos Principle.

If you have a VR headset, clearly you have enough money to buy this. So buy it. Only reason I stopped playing long enough to write this review was because I needed to recharge my controllers. Looking forward to many hours on here in the coming weeks.

Major props to the developers. You guys f*cking rule. Thanks for making one of my all-time favorite games come to life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198341703455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1582327532}
review:
I'm not happy with this purchase. the game is very repititive and the chelleges are too simple. the trailer video was misleading and made me think there would be more action in the game, which there is none.


 Update:
I tried playing it again and it is stilll a shitty game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074836290', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1518044056}
review: This game is absolutely incredible. Croteam is giving us exactly what we need in the VR industry. At this rate they will be leaders in this space. I am loving every second of The Talos Principle. Just wow. The smooth locomotion is perfect. The atmosphere is gorgeous. Support these Devs! This is what other devs should strive to make for their products. This is the template to follow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144974649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1509086928}
review:
Sub-1-hour review.

I made it into 'door 2' and finished one of the puzzles there. So far the game is interesting, and screenshots show things will get more complicated, but the graphics are much less impressive than what I expected by looking at screenshots. The Vive with a 1070 at 400% resolution scale still doesn't look fantastic. That was pretty surprising. It isn't an immersive environment, it 'feels' like a game with walls someone set up. 

My initial thought to level 1 was "I could have made this..."  I certainly hope that changes as time goes on, with the reviews it's been getting >.>   Anyways - this will be updated as I progress. Leaving it as a recommend until that time so I don't upset.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993499036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1673046662}
review: Bought the original version, liked it. Found out there was VR support coming and put finishing the 2D version on hold. I was initially disappointed that VR support wasn't added to the original game, but instead was sold as a separate product. However, having now played the game I realize how much work must have gone into this, all to cater to a small group of VR enthusiasts. Having a full game - not a glorified, gimmicky tech demo but an actual, fully featured game - is exceptionally rare in this space, and Croteam deserve recognition and compensation for their efforts. This is by far the best game currently available for the Vive - an absolute must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995044421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1584763059}
review: This game is fantastic.  I own the non-VR version, but Croteam has done an outstanding job of bringing this to VR.  The game lends itself perfectly to VR and feels like this is the best way to play it.  There are a variety of control schemes to suit people's locomotion preferences and the interaction with the world is intuitive.  I would say it is better than the original.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115773764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1512157054}
review: sooo good

author: {'steamid': '76561198040654274', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 2973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1687209770}
review:
If you have never played The Talos Principle, get ready for the single best VR game available to date.  Puzzle design, narrative, setting, secrets, are all unparalelled in the medium.  Expect dozens of hours of head scratching, from the practical to the existential, as this game works out corners of your mind that you did not know existed.

If you already played The Talos Principle on a boring old monitor and are now wondering if it is worthing paying for the exact same game just to revisit it in VR, the answer is still a resounding yes.  Spatial puzzles are given new life when presented to you spatially, the scale of the world is breathtaking, and you were planning on replaying the game some day anyway just to revisit the excellent writing anyways, right?  If your budget is tight, maybe wait for a sale, but I don't regret repurchasing this game for an instant.

Thank you Croteam, and please tell us that Talos 2 is not too far off into the future!

author: {'steamid': '76561198008214429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1897, 'last_played': 1518867403}
review:
This was one of my best VR experiences, and I have tried most of them.
From the first moment I was sucked in by the atmosphere, and could not put my headset down. It's the first VR game I could play comfortably for hours on end.

The controls are near perfect, and can be tweaked to your liking. Minor improvement suggestion: Scrolling in menus and on terminals is a bit weird, and picking up stuff placed lower than the player is a bit finicky.

The puzzles were fantastic and varied, often adding new twists. The hardest levels were the ones breaking with conventions learnt in earlier levels, but cracking them was very rewarding.

If you had to choose just one VR game, this is the one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055751047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1544975321}
review:
Just finished playing and all I can say is WOW!. I played The Talos Principle and the Road to Gehenna before and loved it. But this VR version just blew my mind. 

For anyone who owns VR and likes the puzzle adventure game genre, this game is a musthave. Great immersion, graphics and relatively easy to control. 

Thank you Croteam for releasing The Talos Principle in VR. It is thanks to developers like you that high quality VR will have a future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062284172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1673565029}
review:
!!! Solid.

Teleport and free locomotion are fine. The worlds could have more interaction, but its still a very good vr-game
and with (hopefully) ten hours gameplay a good choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992925684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1508786027}
review:
I did not play the game before, so I was coming into this game fresh. First off, the VR impmentation is really bad. Two methods of teleportation, one being perhaps the worst impmentation of a parabolic arc teleport I've ever seen. I was playing on Oculus, and it just doesn't feel like it was well considered. The virtual hands don't even align with the controllers.

Visual wise, its pretty bland. The same low res wall over and over. The puzzles did not grab me at all, just super boring and uninspired. Maybe things get better later on but it just wasn't interesting enough to make me want to play more and explore the world. I actually think the vocie over hurts the game, as the story that is trying to be told feels very hamfisted. 

Maybe if you played the game before and are nostalgic the price of entry might be worth it to you. For a VR game, it just feels bland and uninspired.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969101080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1508776062}
review:
Croteam nel suo miglior titolo. Tutti la ricordano per Serious Sam, che Ã¨ un poâ€™ il loro marchio di fabbrica, ma The Talos Principle VR ne rappresenta lâ€™opposto matematico: storia profonda che trae radici da elementi reali, ritmo pacato, fortemente basato sul ragionamento senza azione neâ€™ violenza. Finalmente un gioco in cui tutti i sistemi di locomozione funzionano in modo elegante, che sfrutta al meglio il roomscale ma che si lascia giocare anche senza. Finalmente una longevitÃ  degna di nota, con una curva di apprendimento docile che sale gradualmente soddisfando sia il veterano che il neofita. Una produzione brillante che non dovreste farvi scappare.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971571062', 'num_games_owned': 3301, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1509023480}
review:
[h1]Uno de los juegos con mas configuraciones VR[/h1]
Esta review va a ser corta. 
Realmente no voy a analizar el juego porque creo que todos lo conocemos de sobra. Para mi estÃ¡ clarisimo que es uno de los mejores First Person Puzzlers que hay en el mercado.

Puntos importantes en la version VR: 
-El juego estÃ¡ adaptado a la perfeccion para VR. La inmersion es brutal y los graficos lucen muy bien. (Probado con oculus CV1 + Touch). Es una gozada el simple hecho de pasear por los escenarios y admirar todos y cada uno de los detalles que en la version "no VR" pueden haber pasado desapercibidos.

-Tengo muchos juegos VR y creo que es el juego que mas opciones de locomociÃ³n tiene de todos cuantos he jugado. AdemÃ¡s dentro de algunas opciones hay variaciones, como por ejemplo locomocion libre girando con stick o girando hacia donde miramos o girando hacia donde apunta la mano. Todo un ejemplo que deberian seguir TODOS y cada uno de los desarrolladores de juegos VR ya que cada persona es un mundo y cada jugador se siente comodo con "su" metodo de locomociÃ³n favorito.

-El juego es compatible desde el principio y ademÃ¡s incorpora un asistente para realizar videos de Mixed Reality. Todavia no he podido probarlo, pero creo que es un punto muy a tener en cuenta y que nos hace ver lo muy en serio que se ha tomado esta gente la integracion absoluta de la VR en su juego.

-Este ultimo punto estÃ¡ mas enfocado a la gente que hace gameplays o streaming, pero por si acaso lo pongo. El mirror del juego es bastante correcto y capturando la ventana normal se ve bastante bien.

En resumen. Yo recomiendo el juego 100% para fanaticos de los first person puzzlers que tengan acceso a un HMD y creo que lo disfrutareis sin ninguna duda. No parece una adaptacion, sino mas bien un juego creado expresamente para VR.

Por si quereis verlo en movimiento, os dejo un pequeÃ±o gameplay de mi canal.

https://youtu.be/c7_JCJyH0WU

Si os gusta el video, podeis suscribiros a mi canal aqui:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC0PmKlXopkymAT1A4tLcsIQ?sub_confirmation=1

Miau

review:
Croteam seems to understand how to get VR right...options for movement A+  I'm one those who hates teleport, Ive never gotten sick from any VR game and teleport just breaks the immersion for me...but I understand there are people who get sick...my advice just keep playing you'll eventually become numb to it...as far as that this was already a really good game , and in VR its a really really good game! thanks guys
Now a reqeust for a VR shooter with vehicles...multiplayer ofcourse!   or a VR supercross game...lol

author: {'steamid': '76561197987289348', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1508641631}
review: There are a lot of positive reviews, but I couldn't get beyond about an hour before realizing the entire game is a series of puzzles with identical mechanics and logic. I refunded, as the price does not justify content; VR adds nothing to this game, and makes it somewhat tedious. That's the main challenge with popular 2D titles that have been ported to VR. But that's just my opinion, even if it goes against the current.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970750185', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1508690504}
review:
I played The Talos Principle VR for about 80 minutes before returning it for a refund. Of course I read plenty of the Steam reviews beforehand so I seem to be in the minority in thinking that it was a tedious VR experience.

To me, satisfying hand-tracked VR comes from small-scale actions, even when in the context of large-scale scenarios. Lone Echo has some great examples of this, such as having to turn on and use a handheld laser cutter to free somebody's leg before a spaceship explodes. It's a simple task at its core but it lets you engage in a direct and compelling way. In my hour with The Talos Principle the majority of the action was moving large items around the environment and coming up against the locomotion issues that plague VR.

Lone Echo's motion works because it is tied to your hands and feels almost natural, and is offset by lots of small-scale tactile, hands on activity. Even using your VR tablet to select dialogue responses feels good. The computer terminal in The Talos Principle VR felt similarly satisfying to use.

Robo Recall's teleporting works because it simply gets out of the way of the action, wherein you stand still and shoot/punch/grab/throw stuff. It's simple and almost mindless but it's immediate and satisfying.

Superhot VR has an extremely limited approach to motion: you are teleported to predetermined points and have no choice where they are. You are plopped down in a location for a cool set-piece and then, like Robo Recall, left to stand and murder stuff with fun mechanics.

In my time with The Talos Princple VR there was a shortage of such intimate satisfying "handplay", except for that moment pushing buttons on a computer terminal or solving a tetronimo puzzle. Teleportation is a workaround and doesn't seem appropriate for a game about world-traversal like The Talos Principle, and being somebody who feels sick with full locomotion (mainly rotation) I had to rely on the peripheral-vision-reduction and/or 45-degree snapping, both of which reduce sickness but make it a chore to look around because they are restrictive. All the while playing, I was thinking about how much more effortless it would have been with a keyboard and mouse.

Basically, the game feels like too much time spend engaging with VR weaknesses without enough of VR's strengths. I should clarify that I thought the world was gorgeous; indeed I spent a good while in the opening area just ogling the scenery, and then a while later on a beach, but actually playing the game felt laboured.

For the record, I still have the "flat" version on my wishlist!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011611213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1592952723}
review: Question everything you know while playing the game, and doing it in VR is a wild ride.  However, the most critical thing I can say about it is it needs performance fixes.  It's a beautiful game, but nothing seems too graphically demanding considering I have to play on medium with a 1080ti and 6700k.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991984686', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1513463690}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983142935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1676816996}
review:
a few years ago I played on PC the original game, took several months to complete it, and some star could not get it.
I've only finished 3 gates of world 1, but I can say it's as good as the original.
maybe in VR it is easier to move, sometimes the speed is important, if you do not want a bomb exploded.
It's the best puzzle game I've ever played.
The environment and the soundtrack produce tranquility, much needed to solve some puzzles, which require a lot of concentration.
I think it's a good game to exercise and improve the intelligence needed to solve problems in any environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004261232', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1563562893}
review: The Talos Principle is one of the greatest puzzle games I have ever played. The philosophical aspect of the game, the [spoiler] religious overtone [/spoiler] the amazing puzzle mechanics make this game incredible! Now that I have that out of the way.. VR! This game in VR is the best quality game I have seen in VR in a long time since maybe Space Pirate Trainer or Arizona Sunshine, the amount of graphical fidelity in this game is astounding! Everything looks and feels like I'm actually there! (okay maybe we're not to that point yet, but it's very immersive!) I highly recommend this game, even if it's not in VR it's an incredible game that will take you hours to beat and leave you wanting to beat every puzzle that the game has to offer! Even playing the game a few times! [spoiler] for the multiple endings of course! [/spoilers]

author: {'steamid': '76561198079025399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1537912864}
review:
This plays really well in VR. Graphics are gorgeous as is the audio and the touch controllers feel natural and intuitive. Other developers should take note of how configurable this game is and start providing proper movement options rather than just teleport. This is how it's done.
The game itself is relaxing, addictive and very challenging in places. A sequel is long overdue though, lets hope there's one in the pipeline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025137398', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1545156275}
review: I have over 35 hours logged in the Non-VR version of the game, and thoroughly enjoyed it. I started playing it after I got a map for Destinations that was a Talos Principle map. I had never heard of the game until then, so my first interaction with the game was VR. This rendition is much better now that it is official. Even though I have already solved the puzzles once, I'm really enjoying revisting the worlds in VR. The entire game is much more immersive now, and some of the hidden secrets are much harder to find now that you have to actually look around. I definitely recommend this version of the game if anyone has never played the Talos Principle before, and I also suggest giving it a try to give lots of replay quality to an outstanding game if you have already played through the non-VR version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313886822', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1175, 'last_played': 1562185320}
review: As others have said it's a very good game, I've played about 3.5 hours and the the puzzles are now starting to get a lot more taxing. Definitely recommended if you like puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036169215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 582, 'last_played': 1524531166}
review: So far, I'm only 3 hrs in but I'm blown away by the quality.  Puzzles vary from easy (introducing you to the mechanics) to challenging (requiring creativity and thought).  This is my first time playing the game so I can't compare it to the 'flat' version, but being immersed in the world in VR is just an incredible feeling.  This is easily one of my top VR purchases hands down. The game length will vary from person to person, but the trend seems to be 15-25 hours to complete the game.   Definitely worth the purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998012689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1508592855}
review: first VR game to make me literally vomit from motion sickness, but if you have a more powerful PC you'll be fine. seems like a fantastic game, shame i have to miss out until i can upgrade my PC though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001594246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1697288540}
review: If you haven't played the game yet and you have a chance to try it in VR, you will enjoy it. Although, get yourself a swivel chair or you legs will hurt after hours of gameplay. And hopefully you read this review in future when wireless VR headsets are available. Wireless headset will be a good choice for this type of game as well. This game uses same engine as all Croteam VR titles. Engine is very customizable when it comes to all kinds of options, both graphical and input ones. And Croteam has some talented environment artists. And the game is great in general. Yeah, go play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131764729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1566909520}
review: Well I dont have much more to say then has already been said by everyone els, but only that this is one of my favourite vr games its a proper full game with puzzels beautiful graphics and music. I never played this on flat screen kinda glad I didnt cause I will get a better experience now not knowing whats next. Hats off to the developer this is what I have been waiting for in vr. A great well thought out game that acually took brains and creativity to make it seems most vr games seem to be made by and for dumbasses with good graphics but the same crap over and over again. I want games like old Tomb Raider and old Resident Evil or the newer Alien Isolation in vr. Games that take more then money to make. This game is more like Portal (which I loved too) with adventure and immersion all set in old ruins with a good story aswell as not just graphics but beautiful art and alote more to come. Yes I havent played for very long but I am already amazed. Exellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991079239', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1515450006}
review: This is finally it, a full fledged AAA vr game. Played through most of the game before, and this was worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019201400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1676853353}
review: First and foremost, thank you Croteam for doing such an AWESOME job with Talos VR!  It is everything I'd hoped it would be.  Once again, the level of customization available (graphics, gameplay, movement) is exemplary and blazes the path for other devs to follow.  Dont accept the default settings.  Play with the VR render resolution settings, multisampling, etc...  you might be surprised at how good this game can look!  Gameplay is great so far and is easily the best of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971757509', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1558152380}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007663277', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1509914492}
review:
Unbelievalbe experience. A must buy. Hands down the greatest puzzle game ever made. Yes it beats Portal because portal isnt in VR *yet*. 

If you like intelligent and mind bending puzzles that are not frustrating but simply difficult then this game is for you. 

By VR standards:

Graphics: 10
Gameplay: 10
Immersion: 10
Music: 10
Puzzles: 10
Game Length: 10

Overall....Dont NOT buy this game. Even if you arent big into puzzles this game one will have you questions reality and our existence or what it means to be a human.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977731486', 'num_games_owned': 1136, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1508517419}
review: The original was good but playing it in VR adds a whole other dimension, literally. It's a beautiful looking game; very atmospheric with a deep reaching story. Top VR game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059069181', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1578883481}
review: Croteam did an AMAZING job with this port. The full Talos Principle plus Road to Ghenna DLC in VR. The reviews of the flat version really speak for themselves - a fantastic puzzle game. The VR port is the best I've seen yet by far. A ton of options for everything from graphics to locomotion. Beautiful game with a ton of content. Worth every penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991290007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1582464799}
review: I just purchased and played for an hour. I'll probably update my review once I have so more time with the game but so far it has been very good. The wide range of locomotion, teleportation, and comfort options should be enough to satisfy (almost) everyone. The atmosphere is great and the puzzles are interesting. It's good to have a VR game with a good deal of content!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1508496315}
review:
GTX 1060 (6GB) Gameplay (With Commentary)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A6kbreYYx0o

My Initial Thoughts:
From the creators of the Serious Sam series of games comes an amazing portal-esque puzzle game. The normal 2D version of this game has Overwhelmingly Positive reviews on Steam and is 1 of my top Steam Curator Recommendations. It's now in VR and is a dream come true. DO NOT OVERLOOK THIS GEM! - AWESOME STUFF!
(See my Video above for 1st impressions and gameplay!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028183041', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1561814733}
review:
WunderschÃ¶n und philosophisch, das ist Talos Principle.
Zur Story selbst schreibe ich mal nichts, ist schon in der Spielebeschreibung ausfÃ¼hrlich erklÃ¤rt. 
Als erstes fÃ¤llt die schÃ¶ne Grafik ins Auge. Trotz GTX 970 lÃ¤uft das Spiel flÃ¼ssig und einwandfrei. Und sieht dabei richtig gut aus. 
Auch die Steuerungsoptionen sind gut durchdacht, sowohl Teleportation als auch "normales" Laufen (mit Geschwindigkeitsregelung) sind mÃ¶glich. Allerdings lÃ¤uft man bei der Standarteinstellung sehr schnell, was leichte Motion Sickness auslÃ¶sen kann.
Ein weiteres groÃŸes Plus ist, dass das Spiel komplett in deutsch ist (Text und Vertonung, und die ist gut umgesetzt). Bei den vielen englischsprachigen Titeln mal eine nette Abwechslung.
Die RÃ¤tsel steigen im Schwierigkeitsgrad stÃ¤ndig an und sind abwechslungsreich. Wer das Spiel schon am Monitor gespielt hat, kennt leider schon alles, da es nur eine Neuauflage ist. Trotzdem ist es einen Blick wert, weil es einfach ein anderes SpielgefÃ¼hl ist, mitten in dieser wunderschÃ¶nen Welt RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen.
Mit einer Spielzeit um die 15-20 Stunden gehÃ¶rt Talos zu den lÃ¤ngeren VR-Titeln, womit auch der etwas hÃ¶here Preis gerechtfertigt ist.
FÃ¼r jemanden, der nicht am Monitor gespielt hat, eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Wer es schon kennt, weiss worauf er sich einlÃ¤ÃŸt und wird es vermutlich auch kaufen (25% Rabatt fÃ¼r Vorbesitzer)
Ich werde auf jeden Fall der gÃ¶ttlichen Stimme folgen und noch einige Stunden in der Welt von Talos Principle verbringen.

GruÃŸ
Ziffi

Ziffi als Kurator: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/5837414/

kleiner Nachtrag: Zur Zeit ist die "freie" Bewegung noch nicht ideal gelÃ¶st. Ich dachte Anfangs, es liegt an meinem Controller, aber es scheint ein allgemeines Problem zu geben, dass aber demnÃ¤chst verbessert werden soll. Ist kein Bug, nur nicht gut umgesetzt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972341515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1562303761}
review: I honestly tried to like this game without VR, but in the end, I just didn't feel the urge to continue.  In VR however, it's like a whole new game!  Solving the puzzles while actually being there makes it so much more satisfying it's ridiculous.  As with Serious Sam, the customization from controls to performance is staggering and it shows that they really know what PC gaming and VR gaming are all about.  Excellent job!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092619799', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1585077916}
review: I loved this game out of VR, but it was absolutely meant for this genre, VR brings it home and lets it be experienced the way it is meant to be. This game is fully engrossing both visually and narratively. The controls and persepective I found to be wonderfully customizable, it really let me tailor it to my tastes, because I hate teleporting I was quite happy about this. Best VR puzzle game I have played, and it has a very significant amount of content and playtime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025622980', 'num_games_owned': 649, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1636442061}
review: I already liked the regular desktop version of The Talos Principle, but it's even better with VR. The fact that I can play The Talos Principle in VR from my Linux partition is amazing. I can't wait until I have the time to play through this. Croteam is definitely setting the bar high for SteamVR support on Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967331735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1517165978}
review: Really well done VR port, worth the cash. I owned this game already on PC (and ios), but the effort the devs put into this is very evident, and worth shelling out the full $30. Just about every option you can think of as far as locomotion, comfott, and controls plus a wealth of other graphics options. If we want good VR games we are gonna have to support good VR games with $$$, these companies dont exist to not turn a profit. Unfortunaley, there isn't a huge VR market as is, so hit that buy button if these types of games at all interest you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968516820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1524412044}
review:
Amazing, absolutely amazing. The standard Thalos Principal is one of the best games I've ever played, and in VR its just incredible. The implementation is 2nd to none and it just works, intuative, beautiful, no motion sickness......VR as it was always meant to be in our heads. 

And Bethesda you money grabbing @rseholes, the VR version of the Thales Principal is FREE (sorry, not in your vocabulary, that means 'without charge' ..... 'no money'.....bloody FREE) if you already own the game. Not Â£50 even if you own the base game and season pass......its just included. 

Croteam, you guys rock!!

Bethesda, you guys suck balls

author: {'steamid': '76561198032751389', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1621122449}
review:
Immersion can be an ironically tricky thing to maintain in VR. Movement is limited, controls are few, and vision lacks peripherality. Typically, VR devs are forced to build their game mechanics from the ground up, centered almost entirely on mitigating these limitations. One would think, due to these circumstances and resultant standardized practies, that TTPVR would be lessened somehow; forced to sacrifice some shred of its inital greatness in order to achieve the monumental task of porting a standalone title to VR.

If the developers were any organization other than Croteam, this may have been the case.

Croteam, as is to be anticipated by those who know their works, has once again outdone themselves, creating a fully optimized and polished VR title that has set a new standard for VR titles in the future. The graphics, while now slightly more resource intensive, remain breathtaking. The mechanics are sensible, polished, and fully customizable. the world and puzzles remain navigationally intuitive, and every secret is just as accessible.

The Talos Principle was a wild ride, and now that it's VR, the ride is that much wilder.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978044523', 'num_games_owned': 626, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1508439526}
review: Comfortable movement/lots of VR related options to customize your experience and great storyline/puzzles on top of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975444628', 'num_games_owned': 1326, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1615667926}
review:
How to improve on perfection. The original game is a masterpiece. The only way to make it even better was in VR and this game does just that. The graphics are magnificent, the motion tracking is dead on and the controls give you any way of movement you desire.

The Talos Principle is the best VR game I own on Steam and Oculus, and it shoud be used as a primer for other developers on how to build not just a game, but a work of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993522873', 'num_games_owned': 587, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1523555934}
review: Perfect implementation of the game in VR, like always with Croteam. I've previously completed the flat screen version of Talos, and along with Portal it is at the top of my list for puzzle games with a great narrative. Fortunataly I've found that I've forgotten the solution to a lot of the puzzles so I'm really looking forward to this second more interactive (and physically active) playthrough.

author: {'steamid': '76561198321521681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1525730882}
review: Amazing game, and the VR implementation feels like it was meant to be a VR game, not like it was quickly slapped on as an afterthought. Glad I never played the flat version so I could experience it for the first time in VR.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057313795', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1657114696}
review:
â–ºTHIS = Portal like mind twisting puzzles + beautiful ancient ruins + metaphysics, in VR
â–ºVoted in 'Top VR Hidden Gems you didn't know about' @ JoinUsInVR Group (Key Giveaways) steamcommunity.com/groups/JoinUsInVR

Playing The Talos Principle in VR is like hacking your own consciousness. Yes, you have a brain. And you also have two hands that let you interact with this strange anachronic world of ancient ruins and technology. And you will learn it has great plans for you.

You'll go for an introspective journey that'll help you unfold your Metaphysical intelligence. The puzzles are incredibly clever and often requires you to think out of the box you were comfortable within.

You could also find yourself have a stop just to contemplate the shadows of the upper clouds sliding on those beautiful sceneries or be impressed by the gigantic size of this tower... Magical moments of VR.

The lifetime of the game is pretty larger than what we were used to up to now in VR and the VR version also includes Road to Gahenna DLC wich is awesome too.

Plus Croteam refused to fall into the wall garden strategy trap that FB/Oculus was offering them. So it's still available here for every VR player today. We, as users, could reward this attitude if we care about standing for freedom of choice in this merciless world.

That's a fair price in regards to what a good VR portage it is, and VR definitely unleash the beauty of this existential work of art.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973389596', 'num_games_owned': 911, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 160, 'last_played': 1643289386}
review:
Absolutely stunning port of an already awesome game. This game sets the mark for other AAA VR Ports, both concerning the way the gameplay and controls has been adapted to the new medium, but also in terms of comfort options, which range from insta-TP to a fully customizable "natural sliding" and more.

In case you already played the pancake version and are not sure about spending more money on basically the exact same game, here is my take on it : imagine  the original game as a comic strips made using fotos. Well ... this is the complete movie. It's the exactly the same story and pictures, but at the same time it is SO much more ...

tl;dr : buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970530571', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1509520205}
review:
I was hoping Croteam would give me more of Sam but this is excellent puzzle game and has many VR options.
To sum it up it's AAA title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014862557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 1224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1553193557}
review:
I continue from the old save of the desktop version, I played it for 14 hours and started to wait for VR support and it's finally here. Definitely a better experience in VR because it's easier to perceive distances and angles to solve puzzles, and you get more out of the atmosphere. 

Challenging but not frustating puzzles with an interesting story about philosophy and AI (as I wrote to the desktop review). The pricing is reasonable because it's already cheaper than the desktop version and you get the DLC for free, and the 25% discount for owners of the desktop version.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137123689', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2005, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 847, 'last_played': 1509429280}
review: Finally a game that is fairly inexpensive (25% off if you own the original) that I have played more than a couple hours and not gotten bored. At the time of writing this I'm anout 5 hours in and only about 25% complete and thats if you don't count the collectible stuff I have to go back and figure out. I loved the flat screen version of this game and to be dropped directly into it through VR was everything I hoped it would be. By far the best money I've spent on VR so far!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972939059', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 3809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3809, 'last_played': 1549523824}
review:
Makes for a good "First" VR Experience.   Slow paced puzzle games will always be welcome for VR.

The base game does get a bit boring with it's flat worlds, but Road to Gehenna redeems all that with more verticality in level design.

I kind of wish Croteam would learn to make more levels like Gehenna,  If they did, I gaurantee their games would be getting a lot more attention to the point that they wouldn't suddenly do a 180 and drop out of the VR market.

Also, in regards to that locomotion method that was orginally brainstormed here in your forums, "Sticky forward".
I am dissappointed that you never even bothered to try to get that implemented.  Facebook beat you to it with their Horizons app.  And it works exactly as it was envisioned.  GREAT.  It would have fixed locomotion with Vive Wand touchpads and you would have been hailed as VR hero's for it.

But whatever....Just thankful we got at least Talos before you decideded to bail out.

I'll buy Serious Sam 4, only after you add VR to it.  Not before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082782315', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1533794768}
review: Amazing VR port of orgiional game, absolutly reccomend. It should be noted that there are some issues with Oculus, the handtracking is off center and I can't seem to be able to switch the jump bind from grip to A but those are both easily fixable and hopefully they are soon in a future update. Regaardless, it is a stunning game and is definitly worth the purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072908910', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1538004696}
review:
We need more games like this in VR.  You can take it slow, explore, and enjoy being in a nice virtual world. Of course, the story and puzzles are great as well. 

I seldom spend more than $20 on a game, but this is worth it -- even for me, and I already had the original "normal" version too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995317762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1665037675}
review:
Perfect.
This review concerns the VR update to the original game, not the original game which I consider a superb puzzler.
They did a superb job. A great port should make the original medium irrelevant and it's impossible to tell that it was not a VR title to begin with.

The options are amazing. I'm playing classic movement with the comfort at the largest circle possible so I can nearly see everything while moving yet very comfortable and I removed clicking to move which is MUCH easier physically for long periods and better for the controller. I also made turning do a 45 degree angle which is great for seated. I recently was contacted by Croteam on reddit and told that a seated mode is even in the making which is very exciting! Seated mode works well enough but there are a few parts where you need to stand up to reach something.

The graphics are really good and I experience very little stutter and minimal when it happens on default settings which were quite high for a 7700k cpu and 1080 gpu. Pretty flawless experience. Caught myself just staring at various visual effects like the drones bumping into force fields or the lasers - it's pretty amazing.
As a return player I was a bit concerned that a second playthrough wouldn't be that great but I found that the experience is so elevating in VR that it's worth it. One of the best VR games.
Thanks for including the DLC and giving original owners a discount Croteam. I'm going back in!!! 
11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198297581073', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 3780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1699, 'last_played': 1510702650}
review:
Update: After playing more i can highly recommend this Game. It is the most complete VR Game available right now. Huge beautiful worlds. Satisfying puzzles. Engaging story. Secrets on top of secrets. It is so well designed and big. Right now i am 60% throu the main game(without counting the DLC) and it wont get easier the further i get. You really get your moneys worth out of it. This is a must have Game that raises the bar for VR games in terms of: Complexity, Visuals,Gameplay, Content, Design, Localisation,Immersion. I think one could tell by now that i really enjoy this game.
This is a dream come true for every VR Gamer.

Older thoughts
Wow just wow how this game can suck you in. But what did you think would happen if you take an amazing 2D Game and make a VR port with much love out of it?
Yes an outstanding game.  And it does not feel like a port. It feels like it was made for VR. 
For everyone on the edge it seems prizy but it offers way more in return. 
Thank you for this Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997590136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1702857374}

author: {'steamid': '76561198019032551', 'num_games_owned': 313, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1561320220}
review:
Fan de la sÃ©rie des Portals mais dÃ©cu de ne pas les voir venir en VR, je fus longtemps interessÃ© par The Talos....

Et Ã©tant fan de Croteam depuis toujours, j'a vraiment suivi de prÃ¨s cette team sur Reddit et ici sur Steam.
Ainsi j'ai su des la sortie de Serious Sam en VR que le fameux The Talos allait Ãªtre portÃ© en VR.

J'ai attendu, attendu et attendu. Et il est sorti ! Enfin ! 
Quel bonheur que ce puzzle-game au background mystique et -ils n'ont pas menti- philosophique.

A 3 heures de jeu, je trouve les enigmes plutot faciles mais passionantes. 
A 4, ca devient costaud.
Le scÃ©nario tient ses promesses. L'ambiance aussi.

Les graphismes ne sont pas extraordinaires mais bon ce n'est pas le plus important et ils ne sont pas trop degueus pour autant. Un peu pixelisÃ© mais bon on va pas faire la fine bouche pour un adaption d'un jeu AAA.

Tous les modes de locomotions sont dispo et customizables. Perso je le joue en slide, head direction, vitesse max ,clic sur trackpad et c'est parfait.

Ambiance sonore au top et tout le jeu en Francais ,voix et textes.

Et le DLC fourni avec. 

Vraiment content de mon achat, bon jeu de dÃ©tente et de rÃ©flexion,,Croteam a rÃ©ussi une fois de plus son pari et ne s'est pas foutu de la gueule des joueurs. GÃ©nial. 
En fait non, ce jeu est exceptionnel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198375505515', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1508542175}
review:
Wow. Never played Talos Principle before.  And only played for a couple of hours (all in 1 go) but I think i may have a new favourite VR game!!
I can see myself spending a long happy time with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982432390', 'num_games_owned': 1603, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 942, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1601442960}
review: One of my favorite games ever comes to VR, whatta treat! The adaptation is impeccable. I was stunned by the beauty of the game once within, even after reading glowing reviews. Croteam has nailed VR once again. Highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306602665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1508266344}
review:
No review will ever do justice when it comes to any VR or non-VR titles developed by Croteam. The awesomeness is so insanely high that mere words aren't enough. These guys have 'Serious' passion and dedication for what they do, and you can feel it simply by looking at the quintillion of options they give you in Talos Principle VR and the three other Serious Sam VR titles, allowing you to customize the experience according to your own preference. Read the reviews written by others to find out more about the awesomeness of this masterpiece. But for my review, I'll end it by telling Croteam to just SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY! You can never go wrong by buying it for $40, $60 or $100 even. It's priceless. End of discussion!

Edit (24/11/17): I have now nominated this title for "THE EVEN BETTER THAN I EXPECTED" award

author: {'steamid': '76561198315865889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 5234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1699870126}
review: One of my favorite flat games in VR. What more could I ask? Simply amazing to be inside those worlds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097641030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1226, 'last_played': 1563878668}
review: Wow, just wow. This game looks incredible in vr. So many options to choose to config my graphics it's a bit overwhelming. I pumped everything to max and besides getting a headache cause my system can't handle it, it looked fucken amazing (don't get me wrong it looks great already but man if only I had the extra power). This is one of the best looking games in vr hands down. And knowing the devs the won't rest to they squeeze every last drop of frame out of it. No need to go on about the game because it's won so many awards already. I hope FO4 is optimised like this game. Great jobs guys, own every VR game you have released and yet you still blow my mind with each release.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970664089', 'num_games_owned': 538, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1511555560}
review:
This is a masterful VR conversion of an already beautiful game.  

[list]
[*]This world was already a pleasure to lose yourself in, and is even moreso in VR.  The atmosphere, story, and general experience of the game world lend themselves perfectly to VR.  

[*]The developers have crossed every 't' and dotted every 'i' to ensure that the gameplay experience in VR is a very smooth one--on day one of launch, no less--from the numerous locomotion options to the adaptation of various game mechanics into VR.  They're also very active in the discussion boards here and on the Vive subreddit, working to make sure the user's needs are met.  Other developers take note: this is how a VR game--conversion or not--is done right.

[*]Looks great and runs buttery smooth on my GTX1070 with the Vive.

[*]I had played the heck out of the "flat" version of the game, and being able to actually go "into" this world in VR was worth every penny.  But this would also be great to pick up and experience for the first time in VR, if you never played the original.[/list]

Recommendation: Buy it.  You won't be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972091359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1508542360}
review: I have played The Talos Principle on PC. I really loved all the areas and puzzles. Playing the same game in VR, opens up a different way to view puzzles.  It seems like it is easier when you play VR.  I could of played for hours, but my VR facemask filled up with sweat. I suggest buying this game. I have played a few VR games, but this one just seems to be perfect for VR. You wont be dissapointed. Now my face mask has dried. I think I will go explore some more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971765932', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1518325518}
review: You guys outdid yourself again... I can truly say that this game is down right breathtaking. It is an example of what VR titles should be through and through.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993262439', 'num_games_owned': 340, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1567387991}
review:
Thoughts about the story have been better covered by other reviewers, but I will say it is very well-written and very deep. It can easily change the way you think about humans and humanity and the future of artificial intelligence. You only need to stroll over to the original Talos Principle store page to get a better idea.

Now for the VR aspects...

I played the flat version (several times) and earned every achievement possible. I was hyped for the VR version, and I was NOT disappointed.

Even remembering the gist of the beginning levels, the gameplay did not feel stale at all. In fact, completing the puzzles by hand and in person added a whole new freshness that makes me rather excited to go through the game again and seeing things from a whole new perspective.

Even if you are coming in without having played the original, this is a game that should be in your library. IMO, this is one of the most polished VR experiences to date and a very solid example of how VR games can and should be. It is incredibly immersive and the controls very intuitive.

Highly recommended.

If you get tired of the puzzles, just sit down, see the sights, and smell the artificial roses. And they are aplenty.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161634600', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1516504006}
review: This is what VR owners have been waiting for. Use your wallet to show the devs we appreciate great VR-centric content. Great graphics, great gameplay, AAA all the way. I never played the original Talos, so my replay value may be higher than others...still, instabuy for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296347353', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2428, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1510275808}
review:
Talos Principle was already one of my favorite games of all time, so I did not hesitate to fork out the additional cash to be able to experience it within my HTC Vive.  And not only did it not disappoint.  This reimagining of TP for VR has far surpassed my expectations.  TL;DR - Its AMAZING...BUY IT NOW!!!!

For anyone who hasn't played this game before, I would compare it (as many have) to Portal. Similar to Portal, this will challenge you mentally, without ever being too difficult.  The progression of difficultly is linear and within reason, allowing the player to adequately adapt to tackle most challenges.  Additionally, it does not require that you solve all the puzzles in a given sequence, allowing you to throw in the towel on a puzzle for a while, and come back to it later with a fresh set of eyes. The gameplay is fantastic.  Additionally, the game is absolutely beautiful.  There seems to be zero sacrifice in graphic quality.  The environments and general atmosphere is stunning (and even better when you are standing inside of it). Among the best graphics seen on the Vive so far.  Unlike Portal, the story in Talos does take on a more serious tone.  It is extremely thought provoking and pulls together themes of technology, metaphysics, existentialism, and religion.  

Croteam has truly outdone themselves. This port is amazing. There was clearly a lot of attention to detail when porting the controls and overall experience. Small things (like being able to aim a jamming device as you drop it, or the upgraded VR controls which allow you to freely arrange sigils to unlock doors) makes the VR controls feel even more natural than playing the original game on the flat screen.

My opinion...this is hands down the BEST game available in VR right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972025376', 'num_games_owned': 1072, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1517707822}
review:
Vive: With my 1080 Ti and i7 3770k, I have to put it on 100% in-game SS (already at 2.0 Steam VR SS) and all medium graphics settings to avoid obvious judder. Openvr advanced settings says I'm at about 20% reprojection with these settings, but it looks fine. At settings any higher, I considered it unplayable due to the judder. Someone else told me there are anti-aliasing settings that help when turned off, but I didn't see those. I'll look for them next time.

I'm using classic locomotion, medium speed, no comfort, touch to move, and head oriented movement. If you use hand oriented movement, you have to keep your controller level, and I want to play it with my hand/controller hanging comfortably.  

It's identical to the flat PC game, which is good. The environments remind me of Serious Sam (for obvious reasons), and I can't help but like the chain gun sound when you grab a laser tripod thing. I found the puzzles easier in VR because I think VR made it easier to do spatial reasoning. It was more fun too. I remember getting stuck in the flat version and not trying again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036600217', 'num_games_owned': 369, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1509905886}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007341077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1510397710}
review: Been looking forward to finally playing Talos Principle since I heard (or actually guessed I think) it was going to come to VR in some form. I'm loving every minute of the game so far. It is by far one of the most beautiful games you can experience in VR and I'm only a little way through the game. Well done Devs and thank you for bringing this gem to VR!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068633638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1563827592}
review: If you never played Talos Principle this is the first AAA vr game that you can spend 30-40+ hours in. Everyone knows how great of a game The Talos Principle is it got fantastic reviews across the board. so ill review the VR aspect of it. Its fucking phenominally well done. The devs have so many options to customise how i want to move and how i want to game to look graphically. Just like in their other VR ported games. The actual VR scale is perfect too, everything is just perfect. Ive never played The Talos Principle in non-VR so im gonna beat the whole game in VR baby!!!! just played 1.5 hours straight and so far its fucking cool. highly reccommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986258581', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1508599752}
review:
Copy and paste from what I wrote on reddit:



First off, I never played the pancake version (as the developer jokingly put it) of the game but my first hour was incredible fun. The game is super beautiful (maybe the best looking VR game I played yet, even compared to Robo Recall or Lone Echo), the atmosphere is fantastic (and VR adds a lot to the titles immersion) and the first few puzzles were fun and engaging.

What blew me away though was the option menu of all things, because it is one that is truly worthy of a PC AAA title instead of a PC VR AAA title. Nothing comes close to how polished it feels (except the scroll bars); no Steam VR indie title and no Oculus Studio release. There is an auto detect functionality for the performance stuff, individual presets for GPU performance, VRAM and CPU performance as well as a few dozen options in each category with everything from Ambient Occlusion, the number of internal sound channels, multiple shadow implementations, the ability to switch sound API and so forth. And of course the game supports MSAA (up to 8) as well as allows to set render scale in game. Take that blurry as fuck Obduction as well as all those titles that make me use third party tools (Oculus Tray Tool or Open VR Advance Settings) to set render scale.

All of those take effect immediately and if the renderer needs to restart it does so on its own within a few seconds and w/o you loosing your progress. And this is even true for the ingame (!) option to switch between Steam VR and Oculus SDK (performance seems on par as expected btw...). Take that Bridge Crew and Arizona Sunshine!

When it comes to locomotion, the game supports everything from full locomotion, teleport and blink. Not only that of course, you have a few additional comfort and immersive options. Want full locomotion but something more comfortable? Turn on a reducing FOV while moving (of course you can adjust its level to your liking). Don't have a Rift 360 setup or not enough space to turn around? How about snap turning. Want smooth rotation, they got you covered. And of course, full locomotion is per default controller bound like Onward (take that Mage's Tale), but you can also choose to have it bound to your head direction or play space based (no idea, haven't tried it).

What adds a lot to the graphic is the existence of not only multiple post process color profiles (I use vivid) but also contrast, brightness, saturation and gamma sliders! Oh god, I can't even start to express how much I missed a higher contrast picture in VR, especially (but certainly not limited) for games that I played already on my monitor before (like iRacing). Why the fuck have both Oculus and Valve decided for us that something like that is not needed in VR? Any theoretical possibility to fine tune a games visuals exactly thanks to knowing what VR headset an users has (and the lack of ambient light) never came to fruition and with most games these days being multi platform and a lot more Steam VR headsets coming out in the near future (actually Windows MR released today IIRC) its doubtful that this will ever happen. None of that accounts for player preference anyway. I prefer more saturation and a bit crushed shadows a lot no matter how much the developer fine tunes the composition for a Rift headset (not even mentioning differences in OLED panels).

What is the point of this post? Not completely sure. Probably just to make people aware that Talos Principle is really polished and a cry towards Oculus, Valve and individual game developers to remember that PC players actually value options and customization.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968546721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1564177778}
review:
I'm a big fan of The Talos Principle, and since this is a direct VR adaptation of that game the reviews for the gameplay in the flat version speak for themselves.  I will say if you're going in blind, TP a Portal-esque maze puzzler. You go around giant worlds solving puzzles as a sentient lab rat, but Talos Principle has a much more philosophical bent. You're the subject of a kind of Turing Test, and are never quite sure if what you see and hear is true, or if it's part of the test. Especially interesting are the interactions with Milton on the library terminals, who may be a simple library program, a complicated AI, or a researcher messing with your mind. The more I played, the more I realized I was solving puzzles just to get access to more terminals to continue the conversation. I found it to be an extremely well written, emotionally evolving story with a beautifully designed, fun to play puzzle game thrown in as a bonus.

The puzzles are fun without being punishing, and though you can die from sentry turrets and roaming mines, there are very few gotcha moments, and checkpoints are never very far behind. There is a small bit of jumping puzzle action toward the end (which I'm not a fan of) along with some timed events but those are few and far between. For the majority of the game, Talos is a very peaceful, relaxing game experience. The beautiful open air environments and soundtrack give the game a very zen garden feel.

From the VR side of things, the developers did as good of a job converting Talos Principle to VR as Serious Sam. The best thing I can say is that you'd never know it wasn't made for VR. It has 100%  motion control and roomscale support. It also supports seated and standing if you don't feel like walking around, and full gamepad support if that's your thing.

And locomotion? Play as you like with "classic" FPS style movement on the trackpad or teleport, and steer with headlook or controller aim. Adjust your walking/running speed, teleport speed, with comfort options to curtail motion sickness. Plenty of options to control the game how you like.

The virtual worlds are lovely and have a real sense of place, and the 3D audio is good enough to let you know where enemies and obstacles are just by listening. Again, TP feels like it was made for VR.

If you like puzzles, philosophical sci-fi and are hungry for an AAA quality VR game with substance and playtime beyond a few hours, Talos Principle will make you very happy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016896797', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1522454418}
review:
This adaption from the original is absolutely perfect! The puzzles go from being extremely simple progressively to being quite challenging. The landscapes and graphics in general are simply breathtaking in VR. 

The movement style is extremely configurable so you can dial it in just like you want it. 

Yet again, Croteam has also provided a dedicated method for those who like to use mixed reality! 

This game is simply a must have for those of you who enjoy puzzle based VR games set around breathtaking scenery.
